summary: Interactive romantic-themed Valentine web page (HTML/CSS/JS) with Yes/No options where No evades hover and Yes shows a “Good choice” meme image; designed to run in Chrome on iPad.
architectural_notes: Single-page static site using HTML/CSS/vanilla JavaScript; intended to be run locally in Chrome on iPad.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Romantic meme image with playful hearts and bold caption text “Good choice” (valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1200x800.png)

existing_features.title: Create a single-page interactive Valentine prompt that asks the user (girlfriend) to be the user’s Valentine, with two visible options: “Yes” and “No”, using English for all user-facing text.

Implement evasive behavior for the “No” button: on hover (and on touch interaction equivalents for iPad), the “No” button should move to a new position within the viewport/container such that it is difficult/impossible to click, while keeping the UI responsive and not moving off-screen.
When the user clicks “Yes”, transition the page into a success state that shows a meme image with the caption text “Good choice”.
Apply a consistent romantic visual theme using a pink and white color scheme, with a simple, polished layout suitable for iPad Chrome (responsive, readable typography, and touch-friendly sizing).

Establish a cohesive, creative visual direction for the page (e.g., romantic card / scrapbook aesthetic) and apply it consistently across spacing, typography, and decorative elements without adding additional product features beyond the Valentine prompt interaction.
Add the required generated image(s) as static frontend assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them directly from the frontend (not via the backend).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a simple romantic Valentine ask web page (HTML/CSS/JS) with pink/white theme, optimized to run in Chrome on iPad
Add Yes/No options where the No button moves away on hover to prevent clicking
